Title: Staff Software Engineer - SMB
Description:
Your Job
Contratando esta função remotamente em qualquer cidade do país do Brasil.
Se você tem formação na área da engenharia e adora criar produtos inovadores que alcançam dezenas de milhões de visualizações de página por dia, o Indeed encontrou a pessoa certa. O Indeed oferece a desenvolvedores inteligentes como você um ecossistema de desenvolvimento complexo, com ciclos de lançamento curtos. Lançamos semanalmente diversos produtos que atendem às necessidades crescentes de milhões de empresas e candidatos em todo o mundo.
Responsabilidades:
Você atuará como engenheiro(a) de software da equipe de crescimento de SMB para criar programas que orientam as empresas a anunciar vagas de alta qualidade e a obter um bom desempenho nos resultados de pesquisa do Indeed.
Criará interfaces do usuário e APIs para oferecer instruções úteis às empresas e destacar problemas que podem resultar no não preenchimento de vagas.
Fará parte de uma equipe colaborativa de engenheiros, designers de UX e gerentes de produto muito talentosos. Investigamos constantemente os dados disponíveis no Indeed para analisar, informar e desenvolver soluções para problemas específicos. Se analisar, dividir e organizar os dados de várias maneiras para obter informações interessantes é uma das suas habilidades, esta vaga foi feita para você.
Hiring this role remotely in any city in the country of Brazil.
If you are an engineer who's passionate about building innovative products that scale to tens of millions of page views a day, Indeed is looking for you. Indeed offers smart developers like you a complex development ecosystem with short release cycles. Every week sees the new release of multiple products that meet the growing needs of millions of employers and jobseekers worldwide.
Responsibilities:
As a Staff Software Engineer in the SMB Growth team, you will build software that guides employers to post high-quality jobs which achieve good performance in Indeed’s search results.
You will build UIs and APIs to offer helpful guidance to employers and highlight problems with jobs that could prevent them from being filled.
You will join a collaborative team of extremely talented Engineers, UX designers, and Product Managers. We constantly dig into the data available at Indeed to analyze, inform and develop solutions to the right problems. If looking at data, slicing and dicing it in multiple ways and coming up with interesting insights is something you thrive upon, you will fit right in.
Who You Are
Graduação em Ciência da Computação, Matemática, Engenharia Elétrica, Engenharia da Computação ou área equivalente
Necessário proficiência em comunicação verbal e escrita em inglês
Mais de cinco anos de experiência em programação com pelo menos uma das seguintes linguagens: Java, JavaScript ou Python
Mais de três anos de experiência criando aplicativos de pilha completa com React e Redux
Desejável experiência em GraphQL
Mais de três anos de experiência em mentoria de engenheiros juniores
Experiência significativa com sistemas de grande escala e alto desempenho
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent field required
Proficient verbal and written communication in English required
5+ years experience programming with at least one of the following languages: Java, JavaScript, Python
3+ years of experience building full-stack applications with React and Redux
GraphQL experience is preferred
3+ years of experience mentoring more Junior Engineers
Significant experience with large scale, high-performance systems
Who we are
Somos uma organização de engenharia altamente capacitada, de rápido avanço na construção do site de empregos mais popular do planeta. Com escritórios em Seattle, São Francisco, Austin, Tóquio, Singapura, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen e Vancouver, melhoramos a vida das pessoas em todo o mundo ao facilitar a busca de emprego.
We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.
(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
A faixa de salário-base representa os valores mais baixos e mais altos da faixa salarial do Indeed para esse cargo. Os salários reais variam de acordo com fatores como localização, experiência, desempenho etc. A faixa apresentada é apenas um dos componentes do pacote completo de remuneração do Indeed para funcionários. Outros benefícios podem incluir bônus trimestrais, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), uma política de folgas remuneradas e várias vantagens específicas de cada região.
Salary Range Transparency
Sao Paulo 246,000 - 368,000 BRL per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
O Indeed tem o grande compromisso de criar um local de trabalho e uma comunidade global nos quais a inclusão não só seja valorizada, mas também priorizada. Temos o orgulho de ser uma empresa que oferece oportunidades iguais e busca criar um ambiente acolhedor e diversificado. Avaliaremos a candidatura de todas as pessoas qualificadas sem discriminação de raça, cor, religião, gênero, identidade ou expressão de gênero, quantidade de filhos, estado civil, orientação sexual, nacionalidade, fatores genéticos, neurodiversidade, deficiência, idade, histórico militar, nem por outro motivo que escape ao mérito dos candidatos ou que não seja respaldado pela legislação.
O Indeed tem o compromisso de fornecer adaptações de acessibilidade adequadas para candidatos qualificados com deficiências no processo de inscrição para uma vaga. Para solicitar uma adaptação de acessibilidade, fale com a Central de Ajuda da Atração de Talentos (TA) pelo telefone +55 800 883 6364 ou pelo e-mail TAhelp@indeed.com pelo menos uma semana antes da entrevista.
Our Policies and Benefits
View Indeed's Applicant Privacy and Accessibility Policies - https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs
Learn about our global employee perks, programs and benefits - https://benefits.indeed.jobs/
Leia as Políticas de Privacidade e Acessibilidade para Candidatos do Indeed – https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs
Conheça nossos programas e benefícios globais para funcionários – https://benefits.indeed.jobs/

Title: Desenvolvedor Python Sr (P10211)
GIS Specialist
Description:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry.
Job Purpose and Impact

The GIS Specialist will create highly complex insights on monetizable businesses questions using powerful geo analytics that connect live, bottom up company intelligence and create competitive edge not possible from other ways. In this role, you will seek, understand and agree on the key local business questions to be answered before deploying the plan on data, technology, geo analytics and models, people and culture in the region. You will coach, orient and support diverse teams on the geographic information science usage to solve relevant business questions and guide and advise more junior analysts to use and develop methodologies and medium models focusing on solving powerful and monetizable business questions. Key Accountabilities

Ensure timely availability of key data sets.
Execute highly complex global spatial information science analytics efforts defined by the regional strategy and effectively communicated to the local businesses.
Run, use and challenge global information science team analyses, methodologies and complex models, such as area survey using satellite images, index analysis and spatial analysis to deliver results and intelligence to influence the creation of insights for the businesses.
Transform geographic information science knowledge and usage into businesses insights and competitive advantage to the local business by the development of analysis for internal experts to guide and influence their insights to the commercial and trading teams locally.
Mentor global information science analysts to provide real value, assist them to understand the connection between the team and the local business needs and demonstrate the value of each specific local analysis for the business.
Connect the local geographic information science link among the countryside, trading, analytical and various other teams to gather data and market knowledge in order to better use the spatial analysis to create businesses competitive advantage.
Provide thought leadership for new data, technology, tools and innovation on the regionally geo analytics solutions and support to establish processes to efficiently gather potential insights generating data.
Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Advanced knowledge of highly complex modeling techniques and big data management
Ability to quickly take disparate information and derive accurate insights
Confirmed ability to solve complex problems, execute under tight timelines and pressure
Understanding of markets and interest in how markets work
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Programming knowledge (Python, R, IDL)
Advanced English
Other minimum qualifications may apply Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree
Fluent English

At Cargill, everyone matters and everyone counts. Cargill is committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect. As such and in alignment with our Guiding Principles, Cargill's long-standing equal employment opportunity policy prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant based on race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, family status, citizenship status, veteran status, military status, union affiliation, or any other status protected by law. Cargill also complies with all applicable national and local laws and regulations pertaining to non-discrimination and employment.

Title: Analista de Informações Gerenciais Junior (Laboratório) - São Paulo, SP
Analista Júnior - Estratégia
Analista Jr | Tesouraria SRM
Description:
>> Sobre nós
Muitos acham que sonhamos grande demais, mas aqui na XP Inc. acreditamos no impossível. Nossa história começou em 2001, com um pequeno escritório de agentes autônomos de investimentos em Porto Alegre. Chegamos até aqui com a dedicação de equipes talentosas que tiveram autonomia e liberdade, e abraçaram nossos desafios.
Acreditamos que temos tudo para ser a maior instituição financeira da América Latina, tornando o Brasil referência em inovação e educando financeiramente mais de 50 milhões de brasileiros. É isso que nos move em direção ao nosso propósito de melhorar a vida das pessoas.
>> Nossos valores
Foco no cliente: colocamos os interesses do cliente como prioridade.
Sonho grande: miramos no impossível, construímos juntos os caminhos e chegamos lá.
Mente aberta: estamos abertos para inovar, sempre baseados em fatos e dados, sem medo de errar e dispostos a corrigir.
Espírito empreendedor: assumimos protagonismo na tomada de decisão e focamos nosso tempo na geração de valor a longo prazo.
Se identificou com a nossa cultura? Então embarque nesse foguete!
>> Sobre a vaga
Essa oportunidade é para a área de Strategic Risk Management, que tem a missão de controlar o risco dos derivativos que oferecemos aos nossos clientes, através do controle das métricas (VAR/Stress) e cálculos de fatores de risco (pre,cupom,ipca,gregas) da tesouraria. Esse é um time apaixonado por desafios, você pode se dar muito bem se gostar de ser desafiado analiticamente, de programação e do mercado financeiro.

Principais responsabilidades:
Apoiar nos controles de risco dos derivativos que oferecemos aos nossos clientes
Operacionalização e automatização de fluxos e processos
Aprender sobre produtos de Tesouraria e de mercado financeiro


>> Para esta vaga, é essencial:
Ter a nossa cultura
Conhecimento de Programação (Python Médio/Avançado)
Perfil analítico
Perfil proativo e com vontade de encontrar soluções e aprimorar processos
>> Você pode ter destaque se:
Inglês (reading and listening);
Conhecimento de outras linguagens de programação (VBA, SQL etc.);
Experiência prévia nas áreas de Tesouraria, Riscos ou Mesa de Operações;
Já tiver tido contato com produtos financeiros e de Tesouraria

>> Benefícios para você:
Saúde e bem estar: plano de saúde, plano odontológico, Gympass, Zenklub, VA, VR, seguro de vida.
Maternidade e Paternidade: auxílio creche para pais e mães, licença maternidade de 6 meses, licença paternidade de 20 dias.
Só na XP Inc.: assessoria de investimento e acesso a fundos de investimentos exclusivos.
Sociedade: aqui você terá a cultura, ambiente e ferramentas que precisa para ter condições de ser dono da sua própria jornada e quem sabe até de um pedaço da empresa.
>> #XPdeQualquerLugar
Mais liberdade, autonomia e flexibilidade no seu dia a dia. Aqui, você pode escolher onde quer trabalhar e como vai ser a sua jornada de trabalho.
Trabalhe de onde quiser
Auxílio trabalho remoto de $170
Mobília para equipar seu espaço de trabalho
Saiba mais sobre nosso dia a dia no Instagram CLICANDO AQUI
Confira nossas avaliações no Glassdoor CLICANDO AQUI


"Se te oferecem um lugar em um foguete, não pergunte qual é o assento, apenas embarque."
Sheryl Sandberg

Title: ANALISTA DE INTELIGÊNCIA ESTATÍSTICA JÚNIOR (100% REMOTO)
Data Scientist Jr
Analista de Business Intelligence Junior
Logistics Data Analytics Junior Associate
Description:
The data analytics team uses quantitative analysis to answer strategic questions, develop new metrics, and inform the mental models of leaders focused on providing high-quality data-specific answers to the most important questions. This team has a high impact on logistics, but also to help improve seller and customer experience. You will be developing dashboards, analysis, mapping opportunities and innovation, will work on projects, support logistics leaders for decision making, help set up metrics, explain what drove the SLA and support executives identify and seize strategic opportunities. The outputs are a mix of data tables, slides, SQL queries. Your work will have an influence across nearly every team and your deliverables will drive the area.


Job Description:

Pull data from numerous databases in other to review performance metrics driving business results.
Perform deep-dive analysis to identify problems, and find opportunities to improve the logistics experience.
Prepare and participate in recurrent calls, business reviews, and workshops to support the improvement plans.
Create scalable and transparent reporting mechanisms.
Escalate problems or variances in data to the relevant owners and follow through on the resolutions to ensure they are delivered.


Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Mathematics or Engineering.
Strong communication and writing skills to build effective relationships and influence decision making.
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple competing projects.
Experience writing advanced SQL queries for large datasets.
Good knowledge of statistics, and experience with Python.
Advanced English skills (not mandatory).

Title: Junior Client Reports Analyst
Description:
Brazil
Operations
Global Wealth Management
Job Reference #
253870BR
City
Sao Paulo
Job Type
Full Time
Your role
Are you an organized individual? Are you a diligent, process-driven individual? Are you experienced in working with a high pression environment?

We’re looking for an operations specialist, to support in our Reports routines, for Wealth Management business. The Client Service Specialist is responsible for generating the reports that are sent to customers (On-Shore and Off-Shore). This includes (but is not limited to) contact with counterparties, to receive statements, registration of basic information in the systems, input the client trades in the internal system, price update and it’s validation, analysis of third-party statements and validation of UBS reports. The Junior Client Reports Analyst will work with Front Office, Portfolio managers, as well as partnering with Group Finance, Group Risk, Group Technology and Operations.

Work closely with:
Monthly reports managementSet up Key Performance Indicators for operational routinesBusiness as Usual maintenanceAttend business demandsData analyticsParticipate in Internal & External audit assisting the ManagersParticipate in projects
Your team
You’ll be working in our Operations team in Sao Paulo. We’re responsible for deliver monthly reports for the Wealth Management business.
Your expertise
bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Economics, Engineering, IT, Business Administration or related field1-2 years of equivalent work experience in a client reports or operations department (back and middle-office)knowledge of investment products (funds, bonds, equities, derivatives, etc) - On-Shore and Off-Shoreknowledge of excel, Power BI or Pythongood communication, negotiation and interpersonal skillsdemonstrated ability to meet commitments with all levels of managementideally fluent English
About us
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
How we hire
This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html
Join us
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Analista de Sistemas Java – Junior

São feitas por uma equipe de pessoas"Tipo de vaga: Tempo integral, Efetivo CLT, Autônomo / PJSalário: R$3.800,00 - R$5.040,00 por mêsBenefícios:Assistência médicaVale-refeiçãoHorário de trabalho:Turno de 8 horas

Title: ANALISTA DE DADOS JR
Consultant - Manufacturing
Description:
Who You'll Work With
You'll be based in our Sao Paulo office and will be part of our Operations team.
Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges, blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality. Our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.
What You'll Do
You will play an active role in problem solving for clients including identifying issues, forming hypotheses, designing and conducting analyses and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations.
As part of our two-year Operations Excellence Program (OEP), you will work on client engagements in the same way as any other McKinsey consultant. You will gain leading edge operations and consulting skills primarily through on-the-job coaching which will be complemented by the OEP’s structured capability-building program.
We view the OEP position as the start of a rewarding, challenging and highly flexible career with McKinsey and the Operations practice. During this program, you will serve as a Junior Specialist on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and operations service lines. You will acquire the necessary knowledge and expertise to help companies achieve excellence in their operations.
Along with other members of the OEP community, you will dedicate many days to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts. You will follow a curriculum based on operations excellence themes and will receive advanced training in specific areas of operations.
Additionally, you will engage with our clients to create new strategies across a wide platform of projects, from automation to mine optimization to predictive maintenance and more. You will not only expand our current analytics capabilities but will help architect new strategies and applications within a dynamic innovative organization.
Upon successful completion of the program, you will join our global group of leading experts in operational excellence. We already have OEP graduates working at all levels of the firm from associate to partner.
Qualifications
Undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science and applied math; master's or other advanced degree preferred
3+ years of professional work experience in manufacturing in basic materials (e.g. metals & mining, pulp & paper), oil & gas industries or consumer goods companies
Experience in application of advanced manufacturing technology including digital and big data (e.g. Smart Factory, IoT, Industry 4.0 automation/robotics in world-class production facilities)
Proven record in defining and/or implementing digital strategies across all stages of the value chain
Programming experience with R, Python or related platform is a plus
Proficiency in one or more of the following: predictive analytics (maintenance, production, environmental conditions), optimization, mine planning tools & software, simulations, automation
Knowledge of lean manufacturing (Toyota Production System TPM, Kaizen methods, JIT, SMED)
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment at all levels in an organization
Strong communication skills especially around breaking down complex structures into digestible and relevant points for a diverse set of clients and colleagues
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and written, in English and Portuguese; Spanish is a plus
Comfortable with extensive travel

Title: Junior Sales Engineer
Description:
Let’s talk about Loggi?   
Through technology (mobile, AI, automation, IOT), we have created a next-generation logistics network and we are, in an unprecedented way, positioning ourselves to unleash the growth of a new trade in Brazil with a fast, cost-effective and reliable logistics solution.
By the end of 2021, we want to be present in all Brazilian cities and reach the milestone of 5 million deliveries per day by 2025.
With SoftBank, Microsoft, GGV Capital and others, the new investment round has brought Loggi’s valuation up to US$1 billion hitting the unicorn mark!
Our culture
Inclusive, determined and visionary: that's who we are and how we work here.
We are already more than 1000 Loggers. We are hi-tech, little conservative and we are always up to date! Above all, we hope that everyone is eager to learn and acquire new knowledge quickly.
We look for an increasingly inspiring and welcoming work environment, and we very much hope that you will help us to maintain our culture even at an accelerated pace of growth.
We are very happy to be recognized among the best startups to work according to LinkedIn and Glassdoor, among the 10 most innovative startups by Forbes Brasil and also to be certified by Great Place to Work.
Being part of Loggi must mean that you can be who you are - or want to be. We look for a more accessible country. Thus, we can say that respecting the needs of different people is our reason for existing. This is history, it is culture, it is respect.
Important: All Loggi jobs are also open to people with disabilities (PwD).
Our Engineering team
Loggi’s engineering team is focused on solving highly complex problems, mixing up very experienced professionals and early career employees, in a fortified environment by learning, sharing of experiences and respect. Together, we will build the logistics network of the country, developing unique algorithms, systems and processes.
Our leaders have already left their mark in the national and worldwide tech scenario, working in companies like Google and UOL. They are engaged in finding how to develop a group of more than a thousand programmers to explore the knowledge borders and connect the country.
We believe and invest in everyone's potential:
"Over the next 5 years we want to train Brazil’s future CTOs! Here, we have a structured development program." (Davi Reis, CTO - Chief Technology Officer)
Responsibilities
As a Sales Engineer at Loggi, your primary role will be to understand the needs of our customers and potential customers and to ensure the success of the technological aspects of integration between Loggi products and our customers' software systems with the support of our internal product team.
Requirements
Good interpersonal and communication skills to deal with customers as well as Loggi teams (CX, CS, Sales, Engineering) (Portuguese and English);
Technical knowledge to understand internal software systems and help customers;
Basic software engineering skills, capable of small to medium code changes (preferred by Python);
Basic project management skills, being able to coordinate and communicate the progress of small to medium-sized projects between organizations (internal and external to Loggi).

Benefits
Health plan with national coverage (without discounts!)
Flexible hours with the possibility of working at home according to function and demand
Eligibility for Stock Options
Meal voucher and transportation voucher with symbolic discount of R$ 1
US$ 3,300 for technical development per year
Frequent knowledge exchanges with internal and external professionals
Individual development plan updated every six months
Feedback culture and opportunity to work according to the squad concept
Possibility to develop new algorithms with the challenge of creating the new generation of logistics
Health plan for children at no extra cost
6-month maternity leave and 20-day paternity leave
Daycare allowance of € 100 per child up to 7 years of age.
This job description is written in English because we already have a technology office in Europe, and as we are hiring professionals from all over the world, you can have interactions with professionals who do not speak Portuguese.
Essa descrição de vaga está escrita em Inglês porque nós já temos um escritório de tecnologia na Europa e, como estamos contratando profissionais de todo o mundo, você pode ter interações com profissionais que não falam Português.
